AI/ML Tools.title: ChatGPT
AI/ML Tools.description: ChatGPT is an AI powered chatbot that can interact with users in a conversational manner and is built off of the GPT3 language generation model.

AI/ML Tools.title: InstructGPT
AI/ML Tools.description: InstructGPT is an AI powered chatbot that can interact with users in a conversational manner and is built off of the GPT3 language generation model. This model was trained more directly by humans than ChatGPT and is intended to be more truthful and less toxic.

AI/ML Tools.title: DALL·E 2
AI/ML Tools.description: The DALL·E 2 image generation model is an AI system that generates synthetic images from a written description.

AI/ML Tools.title: Bing Chat
AI/ML Tools.description: The new Bing Chat feature of the Bing web browser is an interactive chatbot that can repeatedly refine searches, summarize and directly cite search results, and generate text from a prompt. Bing Chat is built off of the GPT-4 language generation model but has web search capabilities built-in which provides more accuracy in citations than ChatGPT.

Web-Based Coding Tools.title: JupyterLite
Web-Based Coding Tools.description: Python Read-Evaluate-Print-Loop that can be embedded in a webpage as an iframe

Advocate Groups.title: AlgorithmWatch
Advocate Groups.description: AlgorithmWatch is a non-profit research and advocacy organization focused on algorithmic decision-making and the use of artificial intelligence in a variety of domains.

Advocate Groups.title: The Public Voice
Advocate Groups.description: The Public Voice is a coalition created by the nonprofit Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) that advocates for public participation in decisions concerning the future of the Internet.

Advocate Groups.title: Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC)
Advocate Groups.description: The Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) is a non-profit research organization that focuses on policy, advocacy, and litigation for digital rights.

Advocate Groups.title: All Tech Is Human
Advocate Groups.description: All Tech Is Human is a non-profit that does work in the intersection of technology and society.

Advocate Groups.title: Privacy International (PI)
Advocate Groups.description: Privacy International (PI) is an international charity that works in the space of technology and human rights.

Advocate Groups.title: Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF)
Advocate Groups.description: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) is a non-profit that promotes digital privacy and free speech.

Advocate Groups.title: The Internet Society
Advocate Groups.description: The Internet Society is a global nonprofit working toward the development of standards and protocols for the Internet with a focus on trust, transparency, and security.

Data Rights.title: Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights - The White House
Data Rights.description: This webpage from the White House outlines the major concerns of data collection and algorithmic decision-making and contextualizes how rights can be applied to these concerns.

Data Rights.title: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
Data Rights.description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is the most comprehensive digital rights protection regulations to date. It introduces the idea of a data subject as an entity with specific rights and a data controller and data processor as entities with specific obligations.

Data Rights.title: Ten Questions—And Answers—About the California Consumer Privacy Act
Data Rights.description: This website from the Electronic Frontier Foundation answers common questions about the California Consumer Privacy Act and its effect on users.

Data Rights.title: AI Universal Guidelines
Data Rights.description: This webpage contains the non-profit the Public Voice's Universal Guidelines for Artificial Intelligence. The Public Voice is a coalition created by the nonprofit Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) that advocates for public participation in decisions concerning the future of the Internet.

Data Rights.title: The Privacy Act of 1974
Data Rights.description: This webpage explains the Privacy Act of 1974, one of the earliest data privacy regulations in the United States.

Data Rights.title: 2021 Consumer Data Privacy Legislation
Data Rights.description: This webpage lists privacy regulations throughout the United States by state.

Data Collection.title: Data Brokers
Data Collection.description: This webpage by the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) outlines what data brokers are and how they disseminate personal data.

Data Collection.title: How data brokers find and sell your personal info
Data Collection.description: This article by Norton (one of the most prominent anti-virus providers) outlines the major features of data brokers.

Data Collection.title: What We Learned From Apple’s New Privacy Labels
Data Collection.description: This article contextualizes the Apple app store's privacy labels and explains what is revealed by the information contained in these labels.

Data Collection.title: ‘Anonymized’ Data Is Meaningless Bullshit
Data Collection.description: This article discusses the issues with seemingly anonymous datasets and how they can be directly connected to individual people.

Data Collection.title: Your Apps Know Where You Were Last Night, and They’re Not Keeping It Secret
Data Collection.description: This article outlines the different sources of location data collected by applications and how this affects users.

Data Collection.title: Twelve Million Phones, One Dataset, Zero Privacy
Data Collection.description: This interactive series outlines a variety of issues with privacy and location data collected on users.

Data Collection.title: Federal Agencies Use Cellphone Location Data for Immigration Enforcement
Data Collection.description: This article describes efforts by the Trump administration to monitor the Mexican border for immigration enforcement.

Data Collection.title: Generating user information for use in targeted advertising - Google Patents
Data Collection.description: This patent by Google outlines Google's structure for targeted advertising and how they generate additional information about users.

Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning.title: Machine Bias: COMPAS
Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning.description: This study details how predicted scores for recidivism in Broward County, FL differed based on a person's race in the COMPAS recidivism prediction algorithm.

Natural Language Processing.title: The new AI tools spreading fake news in politics and business
Thousands of Amazon Workers Listen to Alexa Users' Conversations
Is Siri Sexist? UN Report Finds Gender Bias in Virtual Assistants
Amazon scraps secret AI recruiting tool that showed bias against women
What did they know, and when did they know it? The Microsoft Bing edition.
5 Free ChatGPT Competitors You Should Know About For 2023.

Computer Vision.title: Deepfakes, Revenge Porn, And The Impact On Women
Computer Vision.description: This article explains the impact of deepfake videos on revenge porn and the rights of women. These synthesized deepfake videos overlay someone's likeness over a true subject of a video in a highly realistic manner, and these types of videos have gained traction as a method of synthesizing pornography with subjects who have not participated in the depicted actions.

Computer Vision.title: Where Are The Deepfakes In This Presidential Election?
Computer Vision.description: This article contextualizes the use of deepfake videos (synthetic videos with a non-participating subject) during presidential elections and analyzes the risks of these types of videos.

Computer Vision.title: China’s Efforts to Lead the Way in AI Start in Its Classrooms
Computer Vision.description: This article details a variety of digital technologies in use in Chinese classrooms. It specifically focuses on predictive technologies including facial recognition and movement tracking of students (see also https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMLsHI8aV0g).

Computer Vision.title: Self-driving cars have to be safer than regular cars. The question is how much.
Computer Vision.description: This article contextualizes the current state of self driving cars and the most prominent risks of their incorporation into daily life.

Computer Vision.title: Gender Shades
Computer Vision.description: This digital tool reveals the issues with accuracy in image classification tools that recognize gender from IBM, Microsoft, and Face++ AI with a particular focus on accuracy based on skin color.

Computer Vision.title: Google ‘fixed’ its racist algorithm by removing gorillas from its image-labeling tech
Computer Vision.description: This article describes the controversy surrounding Google's response to a image classifier labeling people of color as 'gorillas.'

Human Rights Reports.title: Minority and Indigenous Trends 2020: Focus on Technology
